Posts.Content: Mar 12, 2011 08:34PM karenmdb wrote: I understand what you are going through.  I was diagnosed in 2004.  Married at that time for 19 years.  My husband came to Dr's appointments in the very beginning.  But then stopped - when chemo's symptoms started showing up - he would tell me it all couldn't be the chemo.  If I cried he would not hug me.  Thought he needed to push me through it.  Even told me to "grow some hair"  After all of the treatments were over he began going out alot, yelling at me all of the time.. Told me I wasn't there for him & that I was depressed.  I was depressed over the relationship.  He has decided to get a divorce because he said I  let him down.  OUCH!!!!  I have now been in therapy for a few years now & my therapist tells me he is a narcissist - very selfish, no empathy, it is all about them.  Maybe you can look into it & see if any of the traits fit your BF.  It sounds like they may.  If they do it may give you some understanding & let you see that you do not need to be treated this way.    Good Luck to You -
